body:
See this lengthy comment https://github.com/spack/spack/discussions/20536#discussioncomment-243779, which described two separate fixes for the [Contribution Guide](https://spack.readthedEocs.io/en/latest/contribution_guide.html).

This can be summarized as:
- [ ] Make Flowchart on Top of Contribution Guide:
    - [ ] Clear Fix => Points to whole page
    - [ ] Unclear Fix =>
        - [ ] (b) from below
        - [ ] (c) from below
    - [ ] Large Change =>
        - [ ] (a) from below
        - [ ] find more steps from https://github.com/spack/spack/discussions/20536#discussioncomment-243780, etc

----------------------

The rest was copied from the first linked comment, so it starts at 2.

### 2. Put a flowchart at the top of file X!

At the very top of file X, describe either a literal or figurative flowchart for contributors. The intent of the flowchart would be very similar to our current issue templates, focusing  on triage and documentability.

This is one flowchart I made just now representing the current state of file X:
     - Unclear Fix => ???
     - Clear Fix => Make a fix to spack using all of the instructions on this page.
     - Large Change => ???

#### Contribution Guide Mismatches

There are a couple things I noticed in the contribution guide that made me want to prioritize the "flowchart":
(a) In particular, I wanted to point out that it made me laugh when I found the only existing docs on "writing a big PR" in all of Spack are at the end of a long section on git cherry-pick:
> Note:
> It is important that whenever you change something that might be of importance upstream, create a pull request as soon as possible. Do not wait for weeks/months to do this, because:
>     - you might forget why you modified certain files
>     - it could get difficult to isolate this change into a stand-alone clean PR.

It seems more efficient to be able to address that situation before our users are  rebasing constantly!

(b) And more directly, we have *all* of the content we would need for the "Clear Fix" section of the flowchart -- this is already at the top of the Contribution Guide
> Important is completed feature. The changes one proposes in a PR should correspond to one feature/bugfix/extension/etc. One can create PRs with changes relevant to different ideas, however reviewing such PRs becomes tedious and error prone. If possible, try to follow the one-PR-one-package/feature rule.

- (a) might be rewritten as **a failure mode to avoid from the start** for the "Large Change" section of the flowchart.
- (b) could **replace the "Clear Fix" section of the flowchart entirely.**

### 3. Propose workflow for the "Unclear Fix"

*I propose a workflow specifically for the "Unclear Fix" section of the flowchart from  (2).*

It is not always clear whether it's preferred to ping the slack Y times vs create an issues. In line with the explicit flowchart described in  (2), I would like the section for our customer segment "Unclear Fix" to be something like:
1. *Search* for a similar issue.
2. *Check* Slack, then
3. *Match* labels.

, while modifying the priority of those tasks as seems fit.

And let's call it just **"(c)"** to match the rest.
title: update contribution guide with a flowchart for triage
